intro: Guilleminea densa var. alsinifolia, commonly known as the Alsine-leaved Guilleminea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a soft, velvety texture. The flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
